oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Jodie R. Johnson to young women
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter addressed to Misses [?] and Hattie Norman. Johnson laments that he has heard nothing from home and notes the many changes since the war began. "The dark and bloody tide of war has raged for four years sweeping friend & foe. But thank heaven it has abated at last Desolated our once happy country to make sad and lonely many fire-sides by the absence of loved ones who now sleep in death We saw Cousin Williams name among the slain of Shilough"
